examples: As so often happened, Peter, Tommy and Henry had totally lost sight of their real objective.
The company has outlined a strategic plan with specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound objectives.
It will cast light on the existing objective evidence, the gaps in knowledge and the scientific uncertainties.
One is being a very good, down-to-earth person who recognises that objectives are reached by working with others.
And the machine pursues the objective.
words.defineEn: a goal that one wants to achieve
words.defineVi: một mục tiêu mà một người muốn đạt được

examples: The prisoner attempted to break away from the guards during the chaos.
It attempts to read a floppy disk without regard to its format.
He made no attempt to apologize.
She was attempting to raise $20,000.
The company has attempted to break the strike using non-union labor.
words.defineEn: the activity of trying to complete a task or achieve a goal
words.defineVi: hoạt động cố gắng hoàn thành một nhiệm vụ hoặc đạt được một mục tiêu

examples: Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
You're just chasing your tail at this point, but you might have a breakthrough with the research if you take a break from it.
By this time next year, they will still be living on borrowed time unless a breakthrough is made in medical research.
The scientist's experiments failed many times before she finally achieved her breakthrough, but she kept trying with the belief that if at first you do not succeed, try, try again.
Two of these people will make a breakthrough.
words.defineEn: an important discovery or development that helps improve a situation or answer a problem
words.defineVi: một khám phá hoặc phát triển quan trọng giúp cải thiện tình hình hoặc giải đáp một vấn đề

examples: I've already accomplished several things on my bucket list, but there's still more to do.
He focused on the meat and potatoes of his job, accomplishing tasks efficiently and effectively.
By this time next year, we will have stood fast and accomplished our goals.
Stepping into the shoes of your master is not an easy task to accomplish.
Sarah is getting on for 40, and she's already accomplished so much in her career.
words.defineEn: to successfully finish doing something after experiencing difficulties
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành thành công làm một cái gì đó sau khi gặp khó khăn

examples: The politician made many promises during his campaign, but after he was elected, he failed to fulfill any of them.
John is a responsible man who takes care of his family and fulfills his duties as a husband and father.
In the US, federal bureaucrats fulfill a number of specific important functions.
Fulfill your galactic destiny!
We're going to fulfill the promises of Donald Trump.
words.defineEn: to accomplish or do something that was wished for, expected or promised
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành hoặc làm một cái gì đó đã được mong muốn, mong đợi hoặc đã hứa

examples: I was battling my way along the promenade in the teeth of a force ten gale.
He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
he battle lines has been drawn for years.
The battle lines were drawn yesterday for the fiercest contest in the history of local radio.
Drug companies are locking horns in a legal battle over patents.
words.defineEn: a struggle to achieve or do something
words.defineVi: một cuộc đấu tranh để đạt được hoặc làm một cái gì đó

examples: The company abandoned its outdated marketing strategy in favor of a more innovative approach.
After careful consideration, he abandoned his previous beliefs and embraced a new ideology.
She abandoned her car on the side of the road and walked home.
The ship was abandoned by its crew after it started taking on water.
The government decided to abandon the proposed legislation due to public opposition.
words.defineEn: to completely give up
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn từ bỏ

examples: Comice pears are ideal for canning or making jams.
Rigatoni is ideal for baked pasta dishes like rigatoni al forno with melted cheese on top.
It's not an ideal situation but we all have our crosses to bear.
Though it wasn't ideal, he knew that it was better to have some income than none at all.
The curved ends of penne make it easy to spear with a fork, ideal for pasta salads.
words.defineEn: representing and remarking the standards of perfection
words.defineVi: đại diện và nhận xét các tiêu chuẩn của sự hoàn hảo

examples: The court established, beyond any reasonable doubt, that the man was innocent.
We should go through the established channels for product development.
The lion's roar can be heard from miles away, establishing its dominance.
The company struggled on through some dark days several years ago, but it has since established itself as a dominant force in the market.
It took some time, but eventually, they were able to establish speaking terms again.
words.defineEn: to reach a level of acceptance and recognition due to permanent success
words.defineVi: để đạt được một mức độ chấp nhận và công nhận do thành công vĩnh viễn

examples: Narrator: Tear gas manufacturers aggressively marketed their products to law-enforcement agencies.
-They're aggressively normal!
Meanwhile the young man was staring aggressively at me.
Number one: you're not aggressively and enthusiastically pursuing your goals.
- That is aggressively buttered.
words.defineEn: in a determined manner that is forceful
words.defineVi: một cách quyết đoán đó là mạnh mẽ

examples: Technology advances by fits and starts.
The study yielded significant findings that could advance medical research.
She booked a hotel room in advance to ensure she had a place to stay during her vacation.
The tennis player achieved a clean sweep of her matches, winning every set and advancing to the finals.
I lived on the edge using cash advances to pay one credit card with another until I finally found a job three months after graduation.
words.defineEn: progress or improvement in a particular area
words.defineVi: tiến bộ hoặc cải tiến trong một khu vực cụ thể

examples: There existed no organization to cope with espionage.
A good source of tried and true tips on how to cope with the various aspects of the illness.
When my grandmother passed away, I found comfort in reading books as a way of coping with my grief, as I knew that reading books removes sorrow from the heart.
Mark's friend had passed away, and he found that all things grow with time except grief, as he slowly learned to cope with the loss and cherish the memories they shared.
Nevertheless, he copes.
words.defineEn: to handle a difficult circumstance and deal with it successfully
words.defineVi: để xử lý một tình huống khó khăn và đối phó với nó thành công

examples: We should probably invest in a good home security system.
He invested wisely and became incredibly rich.
He invested in Bitcoin early and made a fortune when the price skyrocketed.
They are making a fortune by investing in the stock market.
Investing in education can go a long way towards improving a nation's future.
words.defineEn: to devote a lot of effort, time, money, etc. to something from which one expects to achieve a good result
words.defineVi: dành nhiều công sức, thời gian, tiền bạc, v.v. cho một việc gì đó mà từ đó người ta mong đợi đạt được kết quả tốt

examples: Since that merger, Costco has attained explosive growth.
But once they became isolated on these Mediterranean islands, some of these little critters attained massive body sizes.
It is about attaining something that is valued by others.
It is a very ambitious goal, if you can attain it.
The problem of diffusion and surface and energy production remained, limiting the size these first multicellular forms of life could attain.
words.defineEn: to succeed in reaching a goal, after hard work
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc đạt được một mục tiêu, sau khi làm việc chăm chỉ

examples: My grandfather often said that idleness is the root of evil, urging me to find meaningful work and stay productive.
My uncle used to warn me that the devil finds work for idle hands when they are not otherwise occupied, urging me to fill my free time with productive activities.
Controlling your train of thoughts not only makes you more productive and effective in your work, it has other, more important benefits as well.
Our company is in perfect working order, and our employees are highly motivated, productive, and committed to our mission.
Instead of engaging in productive work, she spends all her time gossiping with her coworkers - the tongue of the idle person is never idle.
words.defineEn: producing something of value through effective and efficient use of time, resources, and effort
words.defineVi: tạo ra thứ gì đó có giá trị thông qua việc sử dụng hiệu quả và hiệu quả thời gian, nguồn lực và nỗ lực

examples: She realized that the information in the textbook was incorrect.
She realized that her initial assumption was correct.
I realized I'd been had.
She realized the truth in the saying 'a person with too much ambition cannot sleep in peace.'
After a heated debate, the politicians realized the importance of building bridges and finding common ground for the benefit of the nation.
words.defineEn: to achieve something that is desired
words.defineVi: để đạt được một cái gì đó là mong muốn

examples: Cogs in a machine can't strive for excellence.
When Tom's company was struggling to keep up with new competitors, Tom reminded his colleagues that it is ill striving against the stream.
As a teacher, I believe that the sun loses nothing by shining into a puddle, and I strive to give my students the tools and resources they need to succeed.
Instead of hiring the brightest scientists and locking them in an ivory tower with like-minded people, the organization strives to embrace collaboration and a full-stack scope of solutions.
Sarah was always striving for more success and recognition at work, but she found herself constantly stressed and anxious.
words.defineEn: to try as hard as possible to achieve a goal
words.defineVi: để cố gắng hết sức có thể để đạt được một mục tiêu

examples: The CEO of the company was fired after it was discovered that they had been embezzling funds - a harsh lesson that ill-gotten gains never prosper.
They could prosper.
And cheaters don’t prosper.
By the '80s, baby boomers were prospering, and so was Harley-Davidson.
The year is 15 CE and the Roman Empire is prospering.
words.defineEn: to grow in a successful way, especially financially
words.defineVi: để phát triển một cách thành công, đặc biệt là tài chính

examples: Journalists on the spot reported no progress.
Fallen rock is impeding the progress of rescue workers.
Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
He made such quick progress that the others suspected him of having private lessons on the sly.
The parents attended the school meeting to discuss their child's progress.
words.defineEn: movement toward an improved or more developed state
words.defineVi: hướng tới một trạng thái được cải thiện hoặc phát triển hơn

examples: Traditional stores are now pursuing a bricks and clicks strategy.
Her success in the industry had opened doors for other women to pursue similar careers.
Many adult learners enroll in evening classes to pursue further education.
The entrepreneur shot for the moon by pursuing a risky business venture that had the potential for huge rewards.
She put her singing career on the back burner to pursue her dream of being a movie star.
words.defineEn: to try and seek something and engage in it in order to achieve one's goal
words.defineVi: để cố gắng và tìm kiếm một cái gì đó và tham gia vào nó để đạt được mục tiêu của một người

examples: She became more ambitious as the years passed.
The company's ambitious expansion plans went up in flames when their major investor pulled out.
The startup company is reaching for the moon with its ambitious goals to revolutionize the industry.
The ambitious entrepreneur took a risk and started his own business, knowing that it was better to live one day as a tiger than a thousand years as a sheep working for someone else.
The ambitious student knew that he had to take challenging courses to achieve his dream of attending a top university.
words.defineEn: trying or wishing to gain great success, power, or wealth
words.defineVi: cố gắng hoặc mong muốn đạt được thành công lớn, quyền lực hoặc sự giàu có

examples: Seeing no other option, the politician decided desperate times call for desperate measures and made a controversial speech spreading misleading information to sway the crucial election results.
Seeing no other option, the politician decided desperate times call for desperate measures and made a controversial speech spreading misleading information to sway the crucial election results.
In a desperate attempt to beat the clock, I raced to mail my tax return before midnight.
Megan regretted throwing herself at Terry, realizing later that her actions came across as desperate and needy.
It was clear to everyone at the club that Peter was throwing himself at anyone who showed the slightest interest, desperate for attention.
words.defineEn: (of an act) without much hope for its success and done when nothing else works
words.defineVi: (của một hành động) không có nhiều hy vọng về sự thành công của nó và được thực hiện khi không có gì khác hoạt động

examples: Failure was staring him in the face.
This business method takes the risk of failure out of the table.
Success has many fathers, failure is an orphan, indeed.
The boss whaled on us for the entirety of the meeting because of our failure to meet our sales quota.
The woman planted a seed of failure in Michelle Obama before she could even try to succeed.
words.defineEn: the absence of success in achieving a goal
words.defineVi: sự vắng mặt của thành công trong việc đạt được một mục tiêu

examples: The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.

This could not by any stretch be seen as a victory.
They’ve been on the crest of the wave ever since their election victory.
After a difficult start, things were finally on the up and up for the team, with a string of victories in their last few games.
words.defineEn: the success that is achieved in a competition, game, war, etc.
words.defineVi: thành công đạt được trong một cuộc thi, trò chơi, chiến tranh, v.v.

examples: The sun always rises in the east.
The basic pay of the average worker has risen by 3 per cent.
The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
Tax rises have made some inroads into the country's national debt.
On the credit side, inflation has not risen this year.
words.defineEn: to reach a greater status quo and professional position
words.defineVi: để đạt được một hiện trạng lớn hơn và vị trí chuyên nghiệp

examples: She had to accept defeat without losing face.
The defeated army was forced to bow down before their conquerors, acknowledging their superiority.
The rebels are standing fast and refuse to be defeated.
I am working hard to defeat my competitor and to win I have to do or die.
They put up a good fight, but they never really had a chance of defeating us.
words.defineEn: the state of having lost in a contest, war, competition, etc.
words.defineVi: tình trạng thua cuộc trong một cuộc thi, chiến tranh, cạnh tranh, v.v.

examples: I remember feeling hopeless during my job search, but then I reminded myself that it is always darkest before the dawn.
Seems pretty hopeless, eh?
They'll feel hopeless.
It’s not all hopeless.
'Did the lady send you here with these hopeless words?'
words.defineEn: showing or causing despair because there is no possibility for improvement or success
words.defineVi: thể hiện hoặc gây ra sự tuyệt vọng vì không có khả năng cải thiện hoặc thành công

examples: The end-of-year accounts show a loss.
Her loss has been keenly felt.
The team's performance is standing on shaky ground after a series of losses.
The company based its projections on shaky ground, leading to financial losses.
The new CEO is making a lot of tough decisions to cut the company’s losses.
words.defineEn: the state or fact of losing someone or something
words.defineVi: tình trạng hoặc thực tế mất một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: They couldn't predict the disastrous war looming a few years down the road.
The consequences of chronic sleep deprivation can be truly disastrous.
More recently, factory closures due to COVID-19 had disastrous effects on this year's first quarter sales.
it's disastrous
State fiscal situations are disastrous right now, unlike any we have seen in this country's history.
words.defineEn: very harmful or bad
words.defineVi: rất có hại hoặc xấu

examples: The economy is struggling.
The struggle ended indecisively.
She struggled to keep up with the fast pace of the marathon runners.
After all that struggle, their constructive advice fell on stony ground.
For years they struggled to keep their heads above water.
words.defineEn: to put a great deal of effort into doing something, although it is extremely hard
words.defineVi: để nỗ lực rất nhiều để làm một cái gì đó, mặc dù nó là vô cùng khó khăn

examples: The policeman pinched his eyes as if overcome with a sudden stab of pain.
The determined athlete carried the day, overcoming adversity and winning the race with a strong finish.
When the company's financial problems became too severe to overcome, the CEO called in a financial consultant for advice.
Mary gets a frog in her throat whenever she has to sing in front of an audience, but she practices diligently to overcome it.
The scientist understood that every bean has its black, and that even the most promising hypothesis may have flaws that need to be addressed and overcome.
words.defineEn: to succeed in solving, controlling, or dealing with something difficult
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc giải quyết, kiểm soát, hoặc đối phó với một cái gì đó khó khăn

examples: A variety of plants and wildlife thrive on the lush riverbank.
If the head and feet keep warm, the rest will take no harm, and our overall health and well-being will thrive.
We watered the sprouts diligently every day, ensuring they received enough nourishment to thrive.
The cancer survivor, once given a grim prognosis, is now thriving in the land of the living, using their experience to inspire and uplift others facing similar challenges.
I believe that living at college gives you the best of both worlds: a place where both study and social life can thrive.
words.defineEn: to develop or grow well or continue to be successful
words.defineVi: để phát triển hoặc phát triển tốt hoặc tiếp tục thành công

examples: The couple faced many obstacles, but they never lost hope because they believed that hope is a lover's staff.
I'm not afraid of difficulties or obstacles, bring it on!
The experienced hiker knew the trail well and was always one jump ahead, anticipating obstacles and finding the best path forward.
We will stand by you through thick and thin, no matter the challenges or obstacles that come our way.

The scientist faced numerous challenges and obstacles in his research, but remembered that a handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains, and persisted with determination and hard work until he finally made groundbreaking discoveries.
words.defineEn: a situation or problem that prevents one from succeeding
words.defineVi: một tình huống hoặc vấn đề ngăn cản một người thành công

examples: He handed in his notice at the bank and ruined his promising career.
The scientist understood that every bean has its black, and that even the most promising hypothesis may have flaws that need to be addressed and overcome.
The investor knew that every white has its black, and every sweet its sour, and that even the most promising investment opportunities had their risks and potential losses.
After investing in a promising startup, John laughed all the way to the bank when the company went public and he made a substantial profit on his shares.
After realizing that the project was going nowhere, the team decided to drop it like a bad habit and focus on more promising opportunities.
words.defineEn: indicating signs or likeliness of future success
words.defineVi: chỉ ra các dấu hiệu hoặc khả năng thành công trong tương lai

examples: They‘ve been let down by a Republican-led Senate who prioritized political posturing over real solutions.

Well, I do feel there's a sense of being let down from some folks, that they were really hoping that we'd be able to break this barrier.
And I was a little bit let down because this was a version of Facebook that was pre-photos, pre-News Feed, pre-Like button, pre-commenting, pre-everything, essentially.
words.defineEn: to make someone disappointed by not meeting their expectations
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó thất vọng bằng cách không đáp ứng mong đợi của họ

examples: The grape vine in my backyard is flourishing, with clusters of ripe grapes ready for harvest.

High culture also flourished.
Life was flourishing.
The sciences flourished and advanced transportation, communication, and medicine.
words.defineEn: to quickly grow in a successful way
words.defineVi: để nhanh chóng phát triển một cách thành công

examples: Shergar film falls at the first fence in Cannes.
Underneath the orange tree, the leaves gently fall.
The fall knocked the wind out of me.
The leaves fall from the trees in autumn.
People are falling like flies from COVID-19.
words.defineEn: a reduction in size, amount, number, etc.
words.defineVi: giảm kích thước, số lượng, số lượng, v.v.

examples: His business was booming for a while, orders flooding in constantly.

Boom, that thing hits.
Boom, that thing hits.
Boom, done a dynamic boost.
words.defineEn: to experience great growth and improvement
words.defineVi: để trải nghiệm sự tăng trưởng và cải thiện tuyệt vời
